roleset.name: phosphorylate fully, so that all potential phosphorylation sites are occupied

role.descr: thing hyperphosphorylated (e.g. protein or another organic molecule)

example.name: example with agent
example.text: If we hyperphosphorylate eIF4E-binding protein 1, this stops it binding to eIF4E.

example.name: example with result
example.text: The pre-mRNA has to reach a length of 25 nt before the C-terminal end of RNAP II can be hyperphosphorylated to form the elongation complex.

example.name: example with instrument
example.text: HSV-1 serine/threonine kinase US3 hyperphosphorylates IRF3 and inhibits the IFN-Î² production (P1413).
